name: Two Makes A Poetry
description: Trying to arrange my head in a way that does not involve dislodging the scattered flowers, I place my hand on the back of your neck. Ah, who am I to judge, does this concern you? Why should I try to arrange my thoughts in such a way that they do not involve discomposure? Is it the reality of two lives that I want to comprehend, or is it the empty hope that you offer me? Rhetorical question: is there a need to ask, or is this all just a way of avoiding discomfort? Two makes a whole, but a poem is not enough. I need only to hear the silence ring through the walls and glass again and again
